Topic.Title: Amazon has been increasigly bad to third party sellers

Message.Msg: I don't know that I'd call them recession oriented... But, they are geared toward utilizing excess capacity / and moving excess inventory -- for those that cannot do so on own (thus your statement about weaker/subscale outfits is true). On the recession front, we've been in one the whole time, but brainwashing has prevented the self-reinforcing consumer demand collapse. All retail will be hurt, but I'll take Costco over Scamazon as the winner when reality sets in...

Local Copr has grown revenue by a compound annual rate of 26% since 2008, reaching $97.7 million in 2012. Operating expenses in the most recent quarter have been drastically reduced and its bottom line is one penny away from breakeven. Source: Seaking Alpha - Markman Hearing Could Open The Door To Future Revenue Streams For Local

Message.Title: AMZN doing the AAPL topping out dance
Message.Msg: AMZN looks like AAPL did when it topped out. It will just keep falling.
